title: Fabio Giglietto
snippet: This page provides a detailed profile of Fabio Giglietto, highlighting his work as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, his research on disinformation and social media, and mentions his publications in top-tier journals. It also mentions his work on coordinated link-sharing behavior during the Italian elections.
description: The content appears to be a profile of Fabio Giglietto, Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. It highlights his research on disinformation and social media, mentioning his publications and work on Italian elections, suggesting a recent academic profile.

title: Italy at the Polls 2022: The Right Strikes Back 3031292979, 9783031292972 - dokumen.pub

title: REVISITING KEY CONCEPTS IN DIGITAL MEDIA RESEARCH: INFLUENCE, POPULISM, PARTISANSHIP, POLARISATION
snippet: This paper cites Fabio Giglietto's work on the Multi-Party Media Partisanship Attention Score (MP-MPAS) and its application to understanding partisan information dynamics in social media.

title: A Workflow to Detect, Monitor, and Update Lists of Coordinated Social Media Accounts Across Time - Uniurb
snippet: This paper references Giglietto's work on Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior (CLSB) and its use in detecting problematic information and coordinated social media actors, specifically in the context of the 2022 Italian general elections.
description: This paper from Uniurb references Fabio Giglietto's research on Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior (CLSB) in the context of detecting problematic information during the 2022 Italian general elections.

title: Professor of Internet Studies
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is a Professor of Internet Studies at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities, and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. His research focuses on the relationships between social systems, media, and digital technologies, with recent projects focusing on social media analysis, computational social science, and the detection and analysis of disinformation campaigns.
description: The content explicitly mentions Fabio Giglietto as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, and describes his research interests in social media analysis, computational social science, and disinformation detection, aligning with his known areas of expertise.

title: A Workflow to Detect, Monitor, and Update Lists of Coordinated Social Media Accounts Across Time - Uniurb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a paper on detecting and monitoring coordinated social media accounts, applying a workflow to study the 2022 Italian snap election. The research builds on previous work examining coordinated inauthentic behavior.
description: This article discusses a paper co-authored by Fabio Giglietto on detecting and monitoring coordinated social media accounts, focusing on the 2022 Italian snap election. The research builds upon his expertise in coordinated inauthentic behavior.

title: INTERNET STUDIES - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2025/2026 - Credits 8 - Uniurb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is the lecturer for the Internet Studies course at the University of Urbino for the academic year 2025/2026. The course covers key concepts of Internet Studies, media manipulation, and research methods, including social media data analysis.
description: This web mention refers to Fabio Giglietto as the lecturer for the Internet Studies course at the University of Urbino for the academic year 2025/2026, covering topics such as media manipulation and social media data analysis.
